meanings.definition: The state of being plural or numerous.
meanings.sent1: The classroom had a plurality of colors on the walls.
meanings.sent2: The forest was filled with a beautiful plurality of trees.
meanings.sent3: The party had a fun plurality of balloons floating around.
meanings.sent4: Her mind held a vast plurality of creative ideas.
meanings.sent5: The garden displayed a stunning plurality of flowers in full bloom.

meanings.definition: The largest number or part, especially more than half.
meanings.sent1: A plurality of the students voted for pizza as their favorite food.
meanings.sent2: The team won with a clear plurality of points in the game.
meanings.sent3: The cake had a delicious plurality of chocolate chips inside.
meanings.sent4: The sky displayed a beautiful plurality of stars on a clear night.
meanings.sent5: The field trip had a surprising plurality of animals to observe.

meanings.definition: A number greater than the number of other votes received by any one candidate but not necessarily a majority.
meanings.sent1: The candidate won with a slim plurality of votes.
meanings.sent2: The election results showed a clear plurality in favor of the new policy.
meanings.sent3: The race had a humorous plurality of contestants dressed in costumes.
meanings.sent4: The debate had a striking plurality of opinions on the topic.
meanings.sent5: The survey revealed a diverse plurality of preferences among the participants.
